page.title: 02Villages and Settlements.
page.content: There are few settlements apart from the 2 hamlets of Limerstone, situated about the farm, Yafford about the mill; there is one village, Shorwell, situated at the foot of the Downs along the spring line. Its junction of roadways link the village with the others along the same south facing slopes and, via Shorwell Shute, with the northern half of the Island. As a service centre for its rural environment there is the church, a chapel, the post office, a general store and a public house. In Shorwell is a youth club and a builder's yard. The houses are a mixture of local stone, thatched cottages, villa type modern houses, bungalows and some council house. The village is on a bus route. Some inhabitants work on local farms but most work elsewhere (mainly Newport) or are retired.
